original_solution_mapping.L1: Both apple trees will be 10 feet wide at maturity so they will be 2*10 = <<10*2=20>>20 feet wide
original_solution_mapping.L2: Quinton will need to leave 12 feet between these 2 trees so the apple trees will take up 20+12 = 32 feet
original_solution_mapping.L3: Both peach trees will be 12 feet wide at maturity so they will be 2*12 = <<12*2=24>>24 feet wide
original_solution_mapping.L4: Quinton will need to leave 15 feet between these 2 trees so the peach trees will take up 24+15 = 39 feet
original_solution_mapping.L5: Together, the apple trees will take up 32 feet and the peach trees will take up 39 feet so they will take 32+39 = <<32+39=71>>71 feet

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2713.
    Returns: the total space the trees will take up in the yard.
    """
    # L1
    num_apple_trees = 2 # 2 apple trees
    apple_tree_width = 10 # 10 feet wide each
    total_apple_width = num_apple_trees * apple_tree_width

    # L2
    space_between_apple_trees = 12 # 12 feet between them
    total_apple_space = total_apple_width + space_between_apple_trees

    # L3
    num_peach_trees = 2 # implied from 4 fruit trees total and 2 apple trees
    peach_tree_width = 12 # 12 feet wide
    total_peach_width = num_peach_trees * peach_tree_width

    # L4
    space_between_peach_trees = 15 # 15 feet between each tree
    total_peach_space = total_peach_width + space_between_peach_trees

    # L5
    total_space = total_apple_space + total_peach_space

    # FA
    answer = total_space
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Both apple trees will be {apple_tree_width} feet wide at maturity so they will be {num_apple_trees}*{apple_tree_width} = <<{apple_tree_width}*{num_apple_trees}={total_apple_width}>>{total_apple_width} feet wide
Quinton will need to leave {space_between_apple_trees} feet between these 2 trees so the apple trees will take up {total_apple_width}+{space_between_apple_trees} = {total_apple_space} feet

Both peach trees will be {peach_tree_width} feet wide at maturity so they will be {num_peach_trees}*{peach_tree_width} = <<{peach_tree_width}*{num_peach_trees}={total_peach_width}>>{total_peach_width} feet wide
Quinton will need to leave {space_between_peach_trees} feet between these 2 trees so the peach trees will take up {total_peach_width}+{space_between_peach_trees} = {total_peach_space} feet

Together, the apple trees will take up {total_apple_space} feet and the peach trees will take up {total_peach_space} feet so they will take {total_apple_space}+{total_peach_space} = <<{total_apple_space}+{total_peach_space}={total_space}>>{total_space} feet

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Both apple trees will be 10 feet wide at maturity so they will be 10*10 = <<10*10=100>>100 feet wide
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Quinton will need to leave 12 feet between these 2 trees so the apple trees will take up 100+12 = 112 feet
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: Both peach trees will be 12 feet wide at maturity so they will be 2*12 = <<12*2=24>>24 feet wide
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: Quinton will need to leave 15 feet between these 2 trees so the peach trees will take up 24+15 = 39 feet
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L5: Together, the apple trees will take up 112 feet and the peach trees will take up 39 feet so they will take 112+39 = <<112+39=151>>151 feet

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'apple_tree_width' (10) was used instead of 'num_apple_trees' (2).
